zone.line: And when my moonlike stands^car will standchariotwithin
A temple, underneath its hollow fretteddome

line.del: Poised on twelve columns of resplendent stone,
And Around stand Asia & the Earth & thou
Prometheus, and the sisters of the Sea
In memory of the tidings it has borne

zone.line: And gazed upon by living statuesPhidian forms, around
Of thee, and Asia & the Earth, & me
Andthouyou fair nymphs, looking the love we feel
Beneath a dome which fretted with carvengraven flowers
Poised on twelve columns of resplendent stone
And open to the all-surrounding Heaven
In memory of the tidings it has borne
Yoked to it by an amphisbaenic snake

line.del: And Drawn by the likeness of those winged steeds

zone.line: The likeness of those winged steeds will mock
The flight from which they find repose—alas
Withe Wither has wandered now my partial tongue
When all remains unsaid which ye w.d hear!—
As I have said I floated to the Earth
